data.Name: Margot Birnbaum
data.staff_bio:
Margot Birnbaum is a research assistant for the entire Institute and assists both the training and the research teams in preparing and setting up for a wide variety of conferences. She also assists in locating research information for individuals at the Healy Library. Margot writes a column for the Institute newsletter regarding cultural activities that are occurring
in the Boston area that are open for all Institute employees, as well as individuals with disabilities to attend. She received an undergraduate degree in both psychology and philosophy and studied law at Case Western Reserve and University of Connecticut Law Schools for two and a half years.
data.staff_ed:
B.A., Psychology and Philosophy, Wellesley College
Law, Case Western Reserve University
Law, UConn Law School
